intro: Hieracium sarcophyllum, commonly known as the purple meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a purple-tinged center. Hieracium sarcophyllum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
